solution_line_template: Borris uses {grapes_per_6_months} x {periods_per_year} = <<{grapes_per_6_months}*{periods_per_year}={grapes_per_year}>>{grapes_per_year} kilograms of grapes per year.
The increase of kilograms of grapes he needed per year is {grapes_per_year} x {increase_percent} = <<{grapes_per_year}*{increase_percent}={increase_amount}>>{increase_amount}.
Therefore, Borris needs {grapes_per_year} + {increase_amount} = <<{grapes_per_year}+{increase_amount}={total_grapes_needed}>>{total_grapes_needed} kilograms of grapes in a year.
